summary: The document, released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, outlines financial transactions involving Edvard G. Tichborn in January 1960. It details a $2,000 operational advance check drawn on a cover company's account and mailed from Washington, along with a $650 check for part of his total salary, both directed to the Bank of America Wilshire-Sweetzer Branch in Los Angeles, California.
key_findings: Document released under the JFK Assassination Records Act of 1992.
Details financial transactions involving Edvard G. Tichborn in January 1960.
Mentions a $2,000 operational advance and a $650 salary check.
Transactions involve the Bank of America Wilshire-Sweetzer Branch.
